thread.title: Seized Bank Funds Will Go to Terror Victims - WSJ
thread.title_full: Seized Bank Funds Will Go to Terror Victims - WSJ

author: Devlin Barrett
title: Seized Bank Funds Will Go to Terror Victims - WSJ
text:
Seized Bank Funds Will Go to Terror Victims Victims of attacks against Americans, or surviving relatives, are in line to share a $1.1 billion fund By Google+ Updated Feb. 23, 2017 5:35 a.m. ET 
Victims of terror attacks against Americans in the 1970s, ’80s and ’90s will start receiving checks in coming weeks from a $1.1 billion compensation fund carved out of a settlement struck between the U.S. government and a French bank, BNP Paribas SA. 
The government last week began sending out letters notifying roughly 2,300 victims or their surviving relatives they were in line for money from the fund, which was established by... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
